column4: anyone know anything about accessing your encrypted home directory as root from command prompt?
if you don't have the passphrase, you won't get access -- even as root.
i DO have the passphrase. thats the %$%&$^*ing annoying thing.
this might be promising: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/EncryptedPrivateDirectory
yeah ive been there.. was 100% unhelpful. :(
btw.. what is the passphrase? is it the text I typed in when I setup the passphrase or is it the hash that was returned?
the text you entered.
ah.. i was afraid of that..
im 100% screwed now.. I was hoping it was the hash so maybe i just made a typo.. but i know the text i typed in and it dosnt work :(
good thing it was only a fresh install. :P Hello Installation round 2! :D
did you include any characters that might be different if the installer used a US keyboard mapping?  e.g. " might actually be @.
I dont belive so. only a #
ecryptfs-mount-private keeps giving me errors.
ah. :/  typing # on a uk keyboard gives Â£, but if you're using US through and through, I guess that wouldn't have happened.
yeah ive hit that lil snag before. Not this time
what errors does ecryptfs-mount-private give you?
open: no such file or directory, Error locking counter
tbh, I've never used ecryptfs, but it sounds like ~/.ecryptfsrc is missing.
you could find out for sure by doing: strace ecryptfs-mount-private | grep open
eeks.. no idea what all that is. Im jsut gonna reinstall without encryption. this isnt worth understanding
fair enough. :)
